CHAT.comment: MOT does most of the talking , but both Mot and Chi seem to direct the activity equally. Mot , however , is more verbally directive. For the most part , MOT and Chi spend the time between two activities: moving the yellow wand by holding the balls above it and building a structure , which Mot refers to as <modern art> , on the black base. There is some discussion of which objects are magnets , and Mot notes that coins do not stick.

u.a: explains the activity and tells participants that she'll be videotaping their hands
mumbles about what she's doing

MOT and Chi sit at a table; Chi is facing the camera; only Mot's arms are visible; objects are spread out in front of them; Mot removes objects from the black base while Chi picks up different objects from the table
vocalizations of Mot and Chi seem to mimic the noise to which Mot referred when saying <hear this thing> above
stands a silver man on the black base
arranges silver men on the black base
shakes head
holds up the yellow wand , which has several objects dangling from it
holds up the horseshoe magnet which has washers hanging from both ends
touches the red ball with the horseshoe magnet; the ball does not attach
picks up the ball with the yellow wand to demonstrate to Mot that it is a magnet
during the pause , MOT places different objects on the black base while Chi picks up objects with the wand
holds up the blue teddy bear
holds up a string of five washers , the bottom one attached to the black base , with a silver stick
tries to do the same thing as Mot with the nuts

g.ga: make the string of washers stand up

u.a: picks the chain of washers off the base; the chain falls onto the table
holds up the yellow wand with lots_of objects attached to it
begins restacking the washers on the black base
holds the red ball over the yellow wand which now rests on the table; the red ball and the wand repel each other so that the wand moves
holds up the line of washers with the silver stick; the bottom washer is attached to the black base
pulls objects off of the yellow wand
Chi has just attached the yellow wand to the base
places a coin on the base and then removes it
points to the yellow wand in Chi's hand
clears the yellow wand of objects and then holds the red ball above the wand; the ball and the wand repel each other and the wand turns
attempts to do the same thing with the white ball; the wand does not turn
repeats action with the red ball; the wand moves
begins to move the wand by holding the the white ball above the wand; the wand and ball do not touch
helps Mot move the wand with the red ball; the wand and ball do not touch

during pause , MOT plays more with the wand and ball and then passes it to Chi and begins putting objects on the base while Chi plays with the wand and another ball momentarily before playing with the base with Mot
Chi does not seem to be placing the objects on the black base the way Mot would like her to
places two silver men on the side of the black base
MOT has placed washers on top of two nuts , which stand on their sides , forming two round tables
begins to stand the silver man up on top of the black base , next to the table
indicates that Chi should make the silver man stand by attaching it to the side of the black base
is surprised that the silver man stands up on top of the the black base
stands a silver man next to the other table on the base
stands other silver men on the base
places a handful of nuts , which she had been holding , on the table
Chi has attached a silver man to the side of a silver stick which is standing perpendicular to the base; the silver man looks like a flag on a flagpole
nothing too exciting here; Mot and Chi have just added a few more things to their structure; a silver ball sits atop a silver stick
picks up the plastic turtle and studies it
mumbles about what she's doing
